p: Changes in ocean conditions, including temperature, sea ice extent, salinity, pH, oxygen levels and circulation, lead to shifts in the distribution range of marine species 7 8 9 10, changes in primary and secondary productivity, and shifts in timing of biological events 6. Warmer temperatures may also lead to decreases in maximum body sizes of marine fishes 11. The combined effects of the predicted distributional shift and changes in ocean productivity under climate change are expected to lead to changes in species composition 12 and hence global redistribution of maximum catch potential (MCP), with projected increases in MCP in high latitudinal regions and decreases in the tropics 13. These changes have large implications for people who depend on fish for food and income, and thus the contribution of fisheries to the global economy 14 15.
